synthesis.precursors: Pt, Co, Ni, Rh precursors and Mo(CO)₆, using oleylamine (OAm) as reducing agent and solvent

reaction_conditions.post_synthesis: Nanoparticles were washed and vacuum-dried at room temperature

XRD.note: Core lattice constant not explicitly given

XPS.peak_shift: Binding energy shifts for Co, Ni, Mo, and Rh due to alloying

physicochemical_characterization.HAADF-STEM: Core-shell structure with PtCoNiMoRh core and Rh shell
physicochemical_characterization.EDX_maps: Elemental distribution for Pt, Co, Ni, Mo, and Rh is homogeneous

electrochemical_performance.electrolyte: pH-universal: Acidic (1 M HClO4), Neutral, and Alkaline
electrochemical_performance.stability: After 5000 cycles, the overpotential of PtCoNiMoRh@Rh increased by only 1 mV in acidic conditions, and the catalyst remained stable in neutral and alkaline conditions

theoretical_computations.reaction_mechanism: The core-shell structure enhances the interaction between Rh shell and PtCoNiMoRh core, reducing the unoccupied Rh 4d states (especially 4d₅/₂). This optimizes H* adsorption/desorption and facilitates H₂O dissociation. DFT shows Rh 4d orbitals shift with shell thickness, and the H* adsorption energy is more favorable for PtCoNiMoRh@Rh with 1 ML shell.
